content: Parable of the Vineyard
A song of my beloved about His vineyard.
My beloved had a vineyard on a fertile hill.
He dug it all around, cleared it of stones,
And planted it with the choicest vine.
And He built a tower in the middle of it,
And also carved out a wine vat in it;
Then He expected  to produce  grapes,
But it produced  worthless ones.
Woes for the Wicked
Woe to those who attach house to house  join field to field,
Until there is no more room,
And you alone are a landowner in the midst of the land!
In my ears the  of armies , “Many houses shall certainly become desolate,
great and fine ones, without occupants.
For ten acres of vineyard will yield  one bath ,
And a homer of seed will yield  an ephah of grain.”
Woe to those who rise early in the morning so that they may pursue intoxicating drink,
Who stay up late in the evening so that wine may inflame them!
Their banquets are  lyre and harp,  tambourine and flute, and  wine;
But they do not pay attention to the deeds of the ,
Nor do they consider the work of His hands.
